title: Laurent Hatton
text:
Laurent Hatton (born 28 September 1962) is a French <a href="Association%20football">football</a> manager who is last known to have managed <a href="AS%20Poissy">Poissy</a>.
Career.
In 1988, Hatton was appointed manager of French sixth division side <a href="Pacy%20M%C3%A9nilles%20RC">Pacy Ménilless</a>, helping them earn promotion to the French third division. In 2004, he was appointed youth manager of <a href="Al-Rayyan%20SC">Al-Rayyan</a> in Qatar. In 2007, he returned to French fourth division club <a href="Pacy%20M%C3%A9nilles%20RC">Pacy Ménilless</a>, helping them earn promotion to the French third division. In 2012, Hatton was appointed manager of <a href="US%20Quevilly-Rouen">Quevilly-Rouen</a> in the French third division. In 2015, he was appointed assistant manager of <a href="Guinea%20national%20football%20team">Guinea</a>, where he said, ¨The selection is made by the federation but not by the coaches.¨ In 2017, Hatton was appointed manager of Indonesian team <a href="Persikabo%201973">Persikabo 1973</a>. In 2017, he was appointed manager of <a href="AS%20Poissy">Poissy</a> in France.
